title: How to reset all Thunderbird UI / CSS / Theme settings to default?
content:
Hi, some years ago I installed the Monterail theme manually. That means I've missed out on all the recent goodness of updated icons and UI with the default themes, and have a bunch of layout issues I'd like to fix.

However the old folder structure of userchrome etc seems to have been deprecated - I can't find a trace of the old css files that I manually installed for that old theme I used. Which means I can't find the backup default userchrome folder, or delete the old theme files I manually installed. In fact I can't find any .css files in my Tbird user profile directory, which is weird.

So how can I reset all the UI CSS to default so visually I'm using the current default Tbird theme? I can see that this works fine when I create a new profile and try that - it looks great! But I don't want to lose my 12 mail accounts and other config options by deleting my main profile completely and reconfiguring from scratch. Thanks!

title: Reply to email with numbered list
content:
I want to reply to an email that has a numbered list in it (in fact this has already happened several times so it's an issue that I come across regularly). I'd like to leave the list as it is, but the reply will change the numbering, for example: Original email: 1. Item 1 2. Item 2 3. Item 3

Reply > 1. Item 1 Here is my reply to Item 1 > 1. Item 2 I want to reply to Item 2 but after I have typed the reply to Item 1 the system now thinks that a new list starts and renumbers this item as #1. > 1. Item 3 Same issue as above.

Instead of the ">" of course I see Thunderbird's blue line for citing the old email in replies.

How can I reply without corrupting the numbering of the list? Thanks!
creator: christian.hennig

title: Thunderbird crashes when trying to size window using mouse and borders and messages cannot be viewed in Tabs
content:
Since a couple years ago, I had some serious issues with Thunderbird on my company's Win10 notebook. Opening messages in new tabs just created blank tabs, and sometimes, the window got into a state where trying to size it from any border immediately crashed the window. I installed TB on a new machine this morning, and at first, all worked. But after a reboot, I started seeing the same problems on my new machine!

After dozens of crashes, changing profiles, safe mode, etc., I was just about to give up, but then I tried to start TB in "Elevated Mode". Our company uses PowerBroker, and starting "Run Elevated" a program gives it higher levels of permissions (not admin but something between user and admin). Voila. All of a sudden, TB is working again as it used to years before. There seems to be either a serious defect in PowerBroker, Windows or TB, but this defect is probably too rare that it'll get fixed.

So I hope anyone else using TB and PowerBroker can confirm a similar problem and my solution!
creator: alexanderamperez

title: Thunderbird 102+ will not copy messages to Dovecot IMAP with self-signed certificate
content:
I have a CentOS 7 server with Dovecot and self-signed certificates.

If I try to move a message from my local inbox to a folder on the IMAP server under version 102 or later, the message will not move, and no error message is displayed.

The status line states:

"Connected to imapserver..." (where imapserver is the hostname for the CentOS server).

Still having this problem as of 102.8.0

If I revert to version 91.13.1, I'm able to save messages to my IMAP server.

The error console shows nothing helpful.

Any suggestions for debugging further?

title: Delete message does not close window in saved search TB102
content:
Hi,

Very long time TB user. Thank you for such a great app. The new address book and cardDAV access are very good improvements.

A minor interface issue occurs since upgrading to TB102.

My partial config:

  • Open messages in a new message window
  • Close message window on delete (mail.close_message_window.on_delete = true)

The issue shows when using saved search folders:

  • When a message is opened from an account inbox, the message window properly closes on delete.
  • When a message is opened from a saved search folder, the window does not close on delete.

Operating in Troubleshoot mode has no effect.

title: Cant login into email account
content:
A friend of mine uses thunderbird for his email. Now since two days he cant login into one of his email accounts. He uses one gmail and two t-mobile accounts. One of this t-mobile accounts is the problem. He cant login, the loginprombt says that "thunderbird cannot connect to server" after he entered the password. I went with him through some settings and tried other solutions posted here : https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1317758 (and another, cant find it now)

Server settings seem all fine, they are all the same as the other t-mobile account (they should use the same stuff right? Not an email expert) we also tried reinstalling, credentials are fine btw, he can login into webmail

I tried looking into logs etc, but found myself now even more confused. Maybe you guys could help? My guess would be something with that last_modified.json? But what to do with it?

Thank you in advance for any potential help and I wish everyone a great week :)

22:04:54.867 1676927094867 addons.xpi WARN Checking C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\distribution\extensions for addons 22:04:55.627 Found 0 public keys and 0 secret keys (0 protected, 0 unprotected) RNPLib.jsm:541:15 22:04:55.633 services.settings: Failed to load last_modified.json: TypeError: NetworkError when attempting to fetch resource. Utils.jsm:330 22:04:55.995 Layout-Darstellung wurde erzwungen, bevor die Seite vollständig geladen war. Falls Stylesheet noch nicht geladen sind, kann dies zu einem kurzzeitigen Darstellung des Inhalts ohne Formatierung führen. aboutconfig.js:470:9 22:04:56.046 Trying to load C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\libotr.dll OTRLib.jsm:64:11 22:04:56.047 Successfully loaded OTR library C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\libotr.dll OTRLib.jsm:72:13 22:04:56.260 Relative Positionierung von Tabellenzeilen und Zeilengruppen wird jetzt unterstützt. Diese Website muss möglicherweise aktualisiert werden, weil sie sich darauf verlassen könnte, dass diese Funktion keine Wirkung hat. preferences.js:279:2 22:05:31.004 Diese Seite befindet sich im Kompatibilitätsmodus (Quirks). Das Seitenlayout kann beeinflusst werden. Verwenden Sie für den Standardmodus "".

title: The current operation on 'Inbox' did not succeed. The mail server for account xxxxx responded: UID COPY failed.
content:
Hello, I'm new to Thunderbird. This is the first time using.

I'm trying to Archive emails, to clear up space on a near full email server. I've set Account Settings/Copies and Folders according to various posts on this forum. The first few Inbox test emails worked, using the Archive button, and archiving emails from the Sent folder seems to be working ok. But now whenever I try to archive emails from the Inbox, I get this error:

The current operation on 'Inbox' did not succeed. The mail server for account xxxxx@serviceprovider.ca responded: UID COPY failed.

I haven't been able to archive any more Inbox emails. I've also tried just drag/drop, but I'm getting the same error and the emails return back to the Inbox. I'm only selecting 20 emails at a time.

I reinstalled Thunderbird overtop. But no change.

I've tried Compacting, and Repair Folder. But no change.

My system is Windows 10. I originally installed version 68 and the auto updates has upgraded it to the current version. Message Archives is set to Yearly archived folders and I've checked "Keep existing folder structure of archived messages". My Archive folder is structured: "2021" with subfolders "In" and "Sent".

Not sure what to try next. Should I revert to a previous version?

Any assistance is appreciated! Thank you.
creator: beepollen

title: Why does Thunderbird freeze while I'm typing an e-mail?
content:
Thunderbird freezes while I'm typing text in the body of an e-mail, both randomly and after I've typed 40 or so characters. The process pins one of my CPU cores at 100% for 5-10 seconds, then drops the last 15 - 20 characters I've typed when it resumes.

Maybe there's some buffer setting that needs adjsutment but it's hard to imagine overloading an input buffer and triggering a freeze / core pin with a few dozen characters. This doesn't happen with any other application, and obviously shouldn't with Thunderbird.

Increasing mail.db.idle_limit and mail.db.max_open had no effect.

Any thoughts would be most appreciated.
creator: eb40
